title: Poster, "Still Life with Eggs Candlestick and Bowl for Mobil, America: The Third Century", 1976
medium: Offset lithograph on cream wove paper
inscribed:
Imprinted in black below title: Still Life with Eggs Candlestick and Bowl by William Bailey: From a series commissioned by Mobil Oil Corporation for the Bicentennial. Recogonized by the American Revolution Bicentennial Administration.
Below image at lower left Text and logo for Mobil and at lower center across the sheet in black block letters:  Mobil:The Third Century.  Imprinted in black at lower left corner: Mobil above a star logo encircled by the text: American Revolution Bicentennial 1776-1976.
provenance: From the collection of Dan Friedman
description: Framed by the cream colored border of the poster is a color photographic reproduction of William Bailey's painting, "Still Life with Eggs Candlestick and Bowl." The still life of simple crockery and eggs resting on a sideboard is presented at eye level. The clustered objects are balanced by the large expanse of brown wall behind, and the simply rendered geometric furniture molding below.  Title of original drawing is at bottom of image.  Below image at lower left text and logo for Mobil and at lower center across the sheet in black block letters:  America: The Third Century

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, "Still Life with Eggs Candlestick and Bowl for Mobil, America: The Third Century", 1976.
1976. Offset lithograph on cream wove paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-265.
